Articles.Content:
Did anyone find any scientific data from near one of the Easter Eggs or odd places?

Post if you found something interesting.

i was flying a plane to the airport earlier the day to find out the answer of the same queation, but then i failed the landing a few times, and after three laps circling the airport, i landed but the plane decided to explode (i thought my descend was good tho')

so, i would like to know that too
One of the funnier ones I saw is if you have a Kerbal with fairly high Stupidity do a Crew Report on Ike. "You can't help but like Ike."

so the crew attributes have something to do with the reports they make?

wow this game is deep

One of the funnier ones I saw is if you have a Kerbal with fairly high Stupidity do a Crew Report on Ike. "You can't help but like Ike."

An Eisenhower reference? Deep indeed.

so the crew attributes have something to do with the reports they make?

wow this game is deep

I feel like it is either this, or different crew reports are based on parts on the craft; because I had a craft within the mun's sphere of influence that was using a lv-45 and the crew report was "You look down at the cold grey surface. It looks really beat up with craters." and I had another craft with the tiny liquid fuel engine and the crew report was "You look down and try to find a place to land, you feel as if a crater would be the best option." however, the craft was never meant to land.

I feel like it is either this, or different crew reports are based on parts on the craft; because I had a craft within the mun's sphere of influence that was using a lv-45 and the crew report was "You look down at the cold grey surface. It looks really beat up with craters." and I had another craft with the tiny liquid fuel engine and the crew report was "You look down and try to find a place to land, you feel as if a crater would be the best option." however, the craft was never meant to land.

While I haven't tested this out, I got those results from two of the same exact craft. I believe the difference was altitude above the moon, which other people have been reporting as well.
The simplest explanation is that their might be some height thresholds above the celestial bodies that define a low orbit or otherwise. What you experienced is probably that phenomenon.
... Or it could be purely random among a number of canned reports. like Kerbals inflight reactions (subscribed for reference)

I was investigating the airfield today with my jet-propelled science lab and didn't find anything out of the ordinary, even on top of the control tower it was convinced I was just on 'Kerbin's shores'

... Or it could be purely random among a number of canned reports. like Kerbals inflight reactions (subscribed for reference)

That is very possible too!

I'm actually restating my career save and am going to write down all the different combinations of data on Mun and Kerbin. Then I might transfer them to a spreadsheet.
So the Kerbal stats affect the crew report? Sweet. I have some Einstien Kerbals and some Mentally Questionable Kerbals to test that with.
I think there's some science report on Jool referencing the 2001:Space Odissey.
Don't forget, there are different (2 kinds actually) biomes on Mun. So i think crew report message depends on altitude above celestial body and type of nearest biome on it's surface.
The humour is really very funny, i'm not going to repeat any of the ones i saw as i don't want to ruin it for anyone but i urge you all to read everything intently.

I think there's some science report on Jool referencing the 2001:Space Odissey.

Spoiler warning.

http://i.imgur.com/bJShUqZ.png

Don't forget, there are different (2 kinds actually) biomes on Mun. So i think crew report message depends on altitude above celestial body and type of nearest biome on it's surface.

There are a lot more than 2. There is one for each large crater and the flatlands.
I am still resisting the subliminally implanted instruction to eat mint flavoured dessert.
mmmm... miiiint...

There's a funny one if you take a sample on the launch pad.

The KSC has it's own "biome", but the launch pad is another one entirely. If you watch the Goo on the KSC grounds, it's bored.

I failed to get a screenshot, but while orbiting Pol, I noticed that every time I passed a certain spot I would get something about tentacles rising out of the ground.

Strange...

I failed to get a screenshot, but while orbiting Pol, I noticed that every time I passed a certain spot I would get something about tentacles rising out of the ground.

Strange...

On which body was the dead kraken easter egg?

I failed to get a screenshot, but while orbiting Pol, I noticed that every time I passed a certain spot I would get something about tentacles rising out of the ground.

Strange...

assuming you haven't yet, you may want to land at that spot (hint hint). Bring lots of light.
It's not there, though. Maybe it's talking about the strange rocks all over Pol.

On which body was the dead kraken easter egg?

Dead kraken is lying on Bop, near the north pole.
